intro: Hieracium leptopogon, commonly known as the slender-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring sunny to partially shaded environments. Its leaves are narrow and often hairy, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped cluster. Hieracium leptopogon is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its resilience to environmental stress.
